message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL

This paper discusses scientific document summarization using citation contextualization and scientific discourse. The use of citations and discourse structure is common in natural language processing and information retrieval, which suggests that cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are likely sub-categories. Additionally, the use of machine learning techniques such as word embeddings and supervised learning suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the evaluation of the proposed method on biomedical and computational linguistics datasets suggests that cs.DL (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) may also be a relevant sub-category.
